intro: Caragana liouana, commonly known as the Chinese pea shrub, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. It has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Caragana liouana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and fix nitrogen.
